risk_description: 30% of properties and 31.7% of NOI concentrated in California markets
why_material: Economic downturn, oversupply, or tax changes in California would significantly impact performance

risk_description: Amazon represents 6.4% of revenues; top 10 customers account for 15.8%
why_material: Loss of key tenants or unfavorable lease renewals would materially impact cash flow

risk_description: $10.6B (11.4% of assets) denominated in foreign currencies
why_material: Currency depreciation or international economic instability could reduce dollar-reported earnings

risk_description: Active development program with significant capital deployment
why_material: Cost overruns, leasing delays, and financing challenges could tie up capital without generating returns

risk_description: Variable-rate debt and upcoming refinancings
why_material: Higher borrowing costs squeeze margins and limit growth capital

risk_description: Substantial revenue from small number of wireless carriers (AT&T, Verizon, T-Mobile)
why_material: Loss of major carrier or reduced carrier spending would dramatically impact revenue

risk_description: Operates in 25+ countries with revenues in multiple currencies
why_material: Currency swings and emerging market instability directly hit dollar-reported earnings

risk_description: Carriers consolidating or sharing tower infrastructure
why_material: Carrier mergers or infrastructure sharing reduces number of tenants per tower

risk_description: New technologies (satellite, small cells, future 6G) may reduce tower demand
why_material: Technology shifts could make traditional macro towers less necessary or obsolete

risk_description: Leases land under many towers rather than owning it
why_material: Landowner non-renewals or price increases squeeze margins or force tower removal

risk_description: Data centers require continuous power and cooling systems
why_material: Equipment failures interrupt customer services and violate SLAs; legacy infrastructure has higher risk

risk_description: Heavy reliance on cloud providers and tech companies
why_material: Tech sector downturn or shift to self-built data centers threatens revenue

risk_description: Data centers consume enormous electricity
why_material: Rising energy costs squeeze margins; limited power availability constrains growth

risk_description: Complex REIT requirements given technology/service component
why_material: Loss of REIT status triggers significant corporate taxes and hurts valuations

risk_description: Operates in 30+ countries
why_material: Currency fluctuations and varying regulations create operational complexity and volatility

risk_description: Industry experiencing oversupply; occupancy and rates declining
why_material: Competition from new supply threatens pricing power and NOI growth

risk_description: Demand tied to life events and discretionary spending
why_material: Economic downturns reduce storage demand more than necessity real estate

risk_title: Market Saturation & Low Barriers to Entry
risk_description: Fragmented industry with constant new competition
why_material: Difficult to maintain pricing power in oversupplied markets

risk_description: Facilities vulnerable to hurricanes, floods, wildfires
why_material: Customer property damage leads to litigation and reputational harm

risk_description: Rising labor, utilities, property taxes, insurance
why_material: High operating leverage means cost increases directly impact profitability

risk_description: 60%+ retail exposure facing brick-and-mortar headwinds
why_material: Store closures and bankruptcies (Rite Aid, Walgreens) directly impact rent collection

risk_description: Single-tenant net lease properties
why_material: One tenant default means entire property vacant; exposure to weak retailers

risk_description: Retail tenant sales tied to consumer spending
why_material: Economic downturns reduce tenant profitability and threaten rent payments

risk_description: Single-tenant properties difficult to re-lease
why_material: Extended vacancies and retrofit costs hurt cash flow when tenants leave

risk_description: Exposure to challenged retailers (Walgreens, Dollar Tree)
why_material: Multiple simultaneous tenant failures create concentration risk

risk_description: Operating in high-regulation markets (CA, NY, MA)
why_material: Rent control caps returns; new regulations could dramatically reduce NOI and values

risk_description: Active development program
why_material: Construction inflation, labor shortages, permitting delays hurt returns

risk_description: Portfolio in expensive metros (CA, NYC, Boston, Seattle)
why_material: Markets sensitive to economic downturns, tech health, and out-migration

risk_description: Development-heavy business requires significant capital
why_material: Rising rates increase costs and reduce project feasibility; compresses cap rates

risk_description: New luxury apartments in same markets
why_material: Oversupply pressures occupancy and rental rates in key markets

risk_description: Senior housing/healthcare operators face labor shortages and rising costs
why_material: Operator bankruptcies threaten rent payments and property operations

risk_description: Medicare/Medicaid cuts reduce operator revenues
why_material: Regulatory changes impact tenant ability to pay rent

risk_description: Occupancy hasn't fully recovered post-COVID
why_material: Slow recovery or demographic shifts suppress demand

risk_description: Properties must meet strict healthcare regulations
why_material: Non-compliance results in shutdowns, fines, or inability to re-lease

risk_description: Operators struggle to staff facilities
why_material: Labor costs and shortages impact operator profitability and property performance

risk_description: Reliance on operators under triple-net leases
why_material: Operator financial troubles (especially skilled nursing) threaten cash flows

risk_description: Occupancy below pre-pandemic levels
why_material: Slow recovery impacts same-store NOI and valuations

risk_description: Government reimbursement pressure
why_material: Cuts reduce operator margins and ability to pay rent

risk_description: Diverse portfolio (senior housing, medical office, hospitals, life science)
why_material: Operational complexity and varying risk profiles across sectors

risk_description: Skilled nursing faces low reimbursement and high labor costs
why_material: Higher risk of tenant defaults in this sector

risk_description: Major cloud providers represent significant revenue
why_material: Loss of major tenants materially impacts cash flow

risk_description: Rapid tech changes affecting infrastructure
why_material: Competitors with newer facilities could win customers

risk_description: Massive power requirements
why_material: Limited power constrains growth; rising costs squeeze margins

risk_description: Cloud providers (AWS, Google, Microsoft) building own data centers
why_material: Reduces demand for third-party colocation

risk_description: Operates in 25+ countries
why_material: Currency fluctuations and political instability create earnings volatility

risk_description: Malls facing structural decline from online shopping
why_material: Anchor bankruptcies create vacancy cascades

risk_description: Macy's, JCPenney, Sears closures
why_material: Massive vacant spaces difficult to re-tenant; triggers co-tenancy clauses

risk_description: Declining foot traffic
why_material: Reduces tenant sales and threatens viability

risk_description: Mall shopping is discretionary
why_material: Economic downturns dramatically reduce consumer spending

risk_description: Significant debt load
why_material: Vulnerable to refinancing risk if valuations decline and rates stay elevated
